meanings.sent1: I wrote my name with a cees at the beginning.
meanings.sent2: The word 'cat' starts with a cees.
meanings.sent3: The cees looked like a smiley face in the alphabet soup.
meanings.sent4: The cees stood out boldly on the page of the book.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pointed to the cees on the board to teach the alphabet.

meanings.definition: The plural of the letter C.
meanings.sent1: There are many cees in the word 'circus'.
meanings.sent2: The alphabet has many cees and other letters.
meanings.sent3: The cees in the word 'cookies' made it look longer.
meanings.sent4: The cees in the text danced across the page.
meanings.sent5: The child counted the cees in the book with excitement.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Ghana.
meanings.sent1: I need a few more cees to buy that snack.
meanings.sent2: The price was listed in cees at the market.
meanings.sent3: I found some forgotten cees in my pocket.
meanings.sent4: The cees jingled in the vendor's hand.
meanings.sent5: The cees were brightly colored and unique in design.
